org.researchstack.backbone.step

Class Step

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.researchstack.backbone.step.Step
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConsentDocumentStep, ConsentSignatureStep, ConsentVisualStep, InstructionStep, QuestionStep

    public class Step
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Step is the base class for the steps that can compose a task for presentation in an ViewTaskActivity object. Each Step object represents one logical piece of data entry or activity in a larger task.

    A step can be a question, an active test, or a simple instruction. An Step subclass is usually paired with an StepLayout subclass that displays the step.

    To use a step, instantiate an Step object and populate its properties. Add the step to a task, such as an OrderedTask object, and then present the task using a ViewTaskActivity.

    To implement a new type of step, subclass Step and add your additional properties. Separately, subclass StepLayout and implement your user interface.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getIdentifier

        public java.lang.String getIdentifier()
        A short string that uniquely identifies the step within the task.

        The identifier is reproduced in the results of a step. In fact, the only way to link a result (a StepResult object) to the step that generated it is to look at the value of identifier. To accurately identify step results, you need to ensure that step identifiers are unique within each task.

        In some cases, it can be useful to link the step identifier to a unique identifier in a database; in other cases, it can make sense to make the identifier human readable.

      • isOptional

        public boolean isOptional()
        A boolean value indicating whether the user can skip the step without providing an answer.

        The default value of this property is true. When the value is false, the Skip button does not appear on this step.

        This property may not be meaningful for all steps; for example, an active step might not provide a way to skip, because it requires a timer to finish.

        Returns:
        a boolean indicating whether the step is skippable

      • setOptional

        public void setOptional(boolean optional)
        Sets whether the step is skippable
        Parameters:
        optional -
        See Also:
        isOptional()

      • getTitle

        public java.lang.String getTitle()
        The primary text to display for the step in a localized string.

        This text is also used as the label when a step is shown in the more compact version in a FormStep.

        Returns:
        the primary text for the question

      • setTitle

        public void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
        Sets the primary text to display for the step in a localized string.
        Parameters:
        title - the primary text for the question.
        See Also:
        getTitle()

      • getText

        public java.lang.String getText()
        Additional text to display for the step in a localized string.

        The additional text is displayed in a smaller font below title. If you need to display a long question, it can work well to keep the title short and put the additional content in the text property.

        Returns:

      • setText

        public void setStepTitle(int stepTitle)
        Gets the int id for the title to display in the action bar (optional).
        Parameters:

      • getStepLayoutClass

        public java.lang.Class getStepLayoutClass()
        Returns the class that the ViewTaskActivity should instantiate to display this step.

        This method is used within the framework so that steps can define their step view controller pairing.

        Outside the framework, developers should instantiate the required view controller in their ViewTaskActivity delegate to override the ViewTaskActivity's default.

        Returns:
        the class of the StepLayout for this step

      • setStepLayoutClass

        public void setStepLayoutClass(java.lang.Class stepLayoutClass)
        Sets the class that should be used to display this step
        Parameters:
        stepLayoutClass - the StepLayout class to be used to display this step
